document.title: TAMING THE TIGERS: DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, LEGAL PROFESSIONALISM, AND WELL-BEING
document.publication-title: Tennessee Journal of Race, Gender, & Social Justice

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: Associate Professor, Penn State University Dickinson School of Law. This article is dedicated to the memory of Traci Raymond Miscavish and the law students and clinical fellows who honored Traci and her legacy with their work: Erin Bloxham, Danielle Falkowski, Kira Lecznar, and Mallary Willatt. The author acknowledges that use of client stories is a debatable issue and believes that the death of this client, and her family's demonstrated commitment to tell her story publicly since her death, warrant the discussion herein of her case with no names changed. See, e.g., Binny Miller, Telling Stories about Cases and Clients: The Ethics of Narrative, 14 GEO. J. LEGAL ETHICS 1 (2000).
